question: In a 3-phase, 4-wire system, the currents in R, Y and B lines under abnormal conditions of loading are as under : IR = 100 ∠30º A ; IY = 50 ∠300º A ; IB = 30 ∠180º A Calculate the negative sequence current in the red phase:

The currents in a 3-phase unbalanced system are : IR = (12 + j 6) A ; IY = (12 – j 12) A ; IB = (-15 + j 10) A. The phase sequence is RYB. Calculate the positive phase sequence component of the current in the red phase.
The sequence voltages in the red phase are as under : ER0 = 100 V ; ER1 = (200 – j 100) V ; ER2 = – 100 V Find the phase voltage of E_B

The sequence ampacity in the C-phase of and ABC transmission are I_C0 = 7.4 cis 45 deg Amps, I_C1 = 3.8 cis -86 deg Amps and I_C2 = 10.3 cis -126 deg Amps. Determine the total current on the A- phase:

A 3-phase, 10 MVA, 11 kV generator with a solidly earthed neutral point supplies a feeder. The relevant impedances of the generator and feeder in ohms are as under : | Sequence Impedance | Generator | Feeder | |---|---|---| | Positive | j 1.2 | j 1.0 | | Negative | j 0.9 | j 1.0 | | Zero | j 0.4 | j 3.0 | The fault current is most nearly :
A 3-phase, 11 kV, 25 MVA generator with X0 = 0.05 p.u., X1 = 0.2 p.u. and X2 = 0.2 p.u. is grounded through a reactance of 0.3 Ω. Calculate the fault current for a single line to ground fault.

A 3-phase, 3-wire system has a normal voltage of 10.4 kV between the lines. It is supplied by a generator having positive, negative and zero sequence reactances of 0.6, 0.5 and 0.2 Ω per phase respectively. Calculate the fault current which flows when a line-to line fault occurs at the generator terminals.
The per unit values of positive, negative and zero sequence reactances of a network at fault are 0.08, 0.07 and 0.05. Determine the fault current if the fault is double line-to ground.
A 3-phase, 12 MVA, 6 kV synchronous motor has the impedance phase sequences X = 0.05, X' = j0.05 and X" = 0.05 - j0.05. Determine the line to ground fault current possible:
A 3-phase, 12 MVA, 6 kV synchronous motor has the impedance phase sequences X = 0.05, X' = j0.05 and X" = 0.05 - j0.05. Determine the line to ground fault current possible:
REELE Aug2023. Find out the negative-phase sequence component of the B-line from the following set of three unbalanced voltage vectors: VA = 10 cis 30° VB = 30 cis -60° and VC = 15 cis145° volts
A lamp has a mean spherical candle power of 30. Calculate the total flux of light from the lamp.
A 230-V lamp has a total flux of 2,000 lumens and takes a current of 0.4348 A. Calculate the MSCP per watt.
A 200-V lamp takes a current of 1.2 A, it produces a total flux of 2,860 lumens. Calculate the MSCP of the lamp:
A room with an area of 6 x 9 m is illustrated by ten 80-W lamps. The luminous efficiency of the lamp is 80 lumens/W and the coefficient of utilization is 0.65. Find the average illumination.

Two lamps are hung at a height of 6 m from the floor level. The distance between the lamps is 8 m. Lamp one is of 500 CP. If the illumination on the floor vertically below this lamp is 20 lux, find the candle power of the second lamp.

Two lamps A and 6B having intensities of 300 cp and 500 cp respectively are situated 12 ft apart. A screen is placed between them in order that the illuminations on any sides are equal, how much is this illumination?

Two sources of candle power or luminous intensity 200 candela and 250 candela are mounted at 8 and 10 m, respectively. The horizontal distance between the lamp posts is 40 m, calculate the illumination in the middle of the posts.
A 100-cd lamp, which emits light uniformly in all directions, is suspended 2.5 m above the center of the working table, which is 3 m square. Calculate the illumination at each corner of the table.
A lamp of 500 cd is placed at the center of a room, 20 m x 10 m x 5 m. Calculate the illumination in each corner of the floor.
